dogecoin.text:
What's next? 🤔

Twitter (X) is already testing cryptocurrency payments 

If DOGE is added to their ecosystem, it will be a bomb💥

If that happens, Dogecoin could become one of the platform's main currencies, giving memcoins a new boost🔝

(8/9)

Gucci is one of the first luxury brands to embrace memcoins💰

The company began testing payments in Dogecoin and Shiba Inu in several boutiques starting in 2022🐶

Then expanded the opportunity internationally🌍

(7/9)

AMC Theatres, the largest cinema chain in the US, has also embraced memcoins🎥

Tickets and popcorn can now be paid for with Dogecoin and Shiba Inu

It showing the interest of big business in cryptocurrencies🍿

(6/9)

Dallas Mavericks accepts DOGE for tickets and merchandise🏀

Dallas Mavericks - the NBA basketball team owned by billionaire Mark Cuban

Cuban has long been a supporter of Dogecoin, calling it "the strongest cryptocurrency for payments"💸

(5/9)

SpaceX has gone even further, accepting Dogecoin to pay for space missions 🌌

In 2021, it announced the launch of DOGE-1 🚀

The first satellite to be paid for entirely in Dogecoin

(4/9)

Tesla accepts Dogecoin for merch and this isn't the first step Elon Musk has taken to support memcoins 

Tesla is also testing DOGE payments for some car models 🚗

It could open up new opportunities for cryptocurrency payments 💸

(3/9)

Memcoins are not just hype and speculation, they are real money 💵

Dogecoin and Shiba Inu once seemed like joke projects, but today hundreds of companies around the world accept them 💪

From Tesla to Gucci, let's break down who's actually using memcoins in business 

(2/9)

Mark Cuban – Dogecoin is the future of payments

Dallas Mavericks accept DOGE for tickets & merch.

Cuban says DOGE is "the strongest cryptocurrency for transactions."

Why? Low fees, fast transactions, and a huge community.

(3/8) https://t.co/DJfKtJUjjl

Elon Musk – the DOGE King 👑

Musk has been shilling Dogecoin since 2019.

Tesla & SpaceX accept DOGE, and he even hinted at making it the currency of X (Twitter).

One tweet from him – and the price skyrockets 🚀

(2/8) https://t.co/07NYACYIfy
